common.tagline: Organize events with friends using collaborative calendars. Free, open source, and available as cloud or self-hosted.

home.feature1Description: Create calendars, add participants, and let everyone indicate their availability.
home.feature2Description: Set your availability once a week with recurrence patterns and exceptions.
home.feature3Description: Subscribe to events in Google Calendar, Apple Calendar, Outlook, and more.
home.feature4Description: Use our cloud service with no setup required, or self-host it for complete control.
home.feature5Description: Get notified when the threshold is reached or lost via Email, Discord, Slack, or Telegram.
home.feature6Description: Source code available under BSL license. Contribute on GitHub or audit the code yourself.
home.ctaDescription: Create your first calendar in seconds
home.notConvincedDescription: Discover why WhenTo is different from traditional polling tools like Doodle or Framadate.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: At WhenTo, we take the protection of your personal data very seriously. This privacy policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your information when you use our service.

dataCollection.title: Data Collection
dataCollection.description: We collect the following types of data:

accountData.title: Account data:
accountData.description: Email address, display name, encrypted password, language and timezone preferences.

calendarData.title: Calendar data:
calendarData.description: Calendar names, descriptions, participants, availabilities, and configuration settings.

usageData.title: Usage data:
usageData.description: IP address, browser type, pages visited, and timestamps for security and service improvement purposes.

paymentData.title: Payment data:
paymentData.description: Payments are processed by Stripe. We do not store your credit card information.

purposes.service: Provide and maintain the WhenTo service
purposes.communication: Send you important notifications about your account

dataStorage.title: Storage and Security
dataStorage.description: Your data is stored on secure servers located in the European Union. We use SSL/TLS encryption to protect data in transit and appropriate security measures to protect data at rest. Passwords are hashed with bcrypt and are never stored in plain text.

thirdParty.description: We use the following third-party services:
thirdParty.stripe: Payment processing for subscriptions. Please refer to Stripe's privacy policy for more information.

cookies.description: We use cookies strictly necessary for the operation of the service:

essential.description: Used for authentication and remembering your preferences. These cookies are necessary for the service to function.

userRights.title: Your Rights
userRights.description: In accordance with GDPR, you have the following rights:
userRights.access: Right of access: You can request a copy of your personal data.
userRights.rectification: Right to rectification: You can correct your data through your account settings.
userRights.erasure: Right to erasure: You can request deletion of your account and data.
userRights.portability: Right to portability: You can export your data in a readable format.
userRights.objection: Right to object: You can object to the processing of your data in certain cases.

dataRetention.title: Data Retention
dataRetention.description: We retain your data as long as your account is active. After account deletion, your data is permanently deleted within 30 days, unless we are legally required to retain it longer.

children.title: Minors
children.description: Minors may use WhenTo under the responsibility of their parents or legal guardians. For users under 15 years old in France, parental consent is required in accordance with GDPR.

changes.title: Changes
changes.description: We may update this privacy policy. Significant changes will be notified by email or through the service. We encourage you to review this page regularly.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: For any questions about this privacy policy or to exercise your rights, contact us at privacy{'@'}whento.be.

why.heroSubtitle: Discover why WhenTo is different from traditional date polling tools and how it can transform your recurring event planning.
why.problemDescription: Tools like Doodle or Framadate are great for finding a one-time date. But for recurring events, it's a different story.
why.problem1Description: Every week, you need to create a new poll and resend the link to everyone.
why.problem2Description: You can't say "I'm available every Tuesday evening" - you have to click on each date individually.
why.problem3Description: Once the date is chosen, you have to manually add it to your calendar.
why.solutionDescription: WhenTo rethinks collaborative planning for groups that meet regularly.
why.solution1Description: One shared calendar for all your sessions. No more creating new polls.
why.solution2Description: Validated events automatically appear in Google Calendar, Outlook, Apple Calendar, or any app supporting iCal links.
why.solution3Description: Set your weekly availability once, with exceptions for special weeks.
why.solution4Description: Self-hosted, open source, no tracking or ads. Your data stays yours.
why.comparisonSubtitle: See how WhenTo stands out from traditional date polling solutions.
why.useCasesSubtitle: WhenTo is designed for groups that meet regularly.
why.useCase1Description: Organize your weekly sessions without sending a new Doodle every week.
why.useCase2Description: Manage your team's availability for recurring practices and games.
why.useCase3Description: Schedule your rehearsals when all members are available.
why.useCase4Description: Automatically find the ideal slot for your weekly meetings.
why.openSourceDescription: WhenTo is available under the Business Source License 1.1 (BSL). You can self-host it for personal or internal use, contribute to the code, or simply use our cloud version.
why.ctaDescription: Create your first collaborative calendar in seconds.
